musicalLanguage.description: One of the most performed Latin songs ever written, this bolero by Consuelo Velazquez is built on passionate D minor harmony with dramatic leaps in the melody. The arrangement captures the song's yearning quality through expressive chord voicings and a melody that reaches upward with romantic urgency. The bolero rhythm in the left hand provides a gentle, swaying pulse.
musicalLanguage.structure: A section: Dm-Gm-A7-Dm (4 bars), B section: chromatic intensification (4 bars)
keyMoments: Bar 1: Dm — the melody's opening leap from D to A sets the passionate tone.
Bar 3: A7 — the dominant with its sharp leading tone C#. Maximum tension.
Bars 5-6: The bridge lifts to Bb major — a moment of warmth in the minor landscape.
teachingGoals: Bolero rhythm pattern in the left hand
Expressive melodic leaps — reaching with intention
Minor key romantic expression with chromatic harmony
styleTips: Play with passion but control — bolero is smoldering, not explosive
Melody should sing and sustain — use pedal for legato
Left hand bolero pattern: bass note, then chord, gently rocking

measures.leftHand: D3:q A3 D4:q D3:q A3 D4:q
measures.teachingNote: Dm — the leap from D to A is the soul of the melody. Make it yearning.

measures.leftHand: G3:q Bb3 D4:q G3:q Bb3 D4:q
measures.teachingNote: Gm — melody climbs stepwise. The bolero rhythm keeps swaying.

measures.leftHand: A2:q C#3 E3:q A2:q C#3 E3:q
measures.teachingNote: A7 — dominant tension. C# in the left hand pulls toward D.
Dm — resolution. The rest lets the phrase breathe before the next section.
Bb major — warm contrast to the minor. Melody stretches to Bb4.
C7 — descending melody with rising intensity. Dramatic contrast.
A7 — chromatic descent in the melody. C# is the final pull toward home.
Dm — whole note resolution. Let it ring with all the longing.
